job_title: Marketing Director in Midwest City, OK
pros: College President Dr Jeanie Webb is a very visionary leader and just a great person to work with!
cons: none to be concerned about

job_title: Anonymous/Employee in Midwest City, OK
pros: Current climate is toxic. Administration turns blind eye to obvious issues. If you are not part of the click you will not get far or see any advancement. People will be cut throat and back stab if they don't like you. The place is great if you actually get along with the "popular kids" but there's no telling how they pick their people. Good luck.
cons: No support from those in charge when clear issues arise. Way too much red tape.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Community, co workers, connections, support, genuine
cons: Pay is a large problem. Working full time and needing state assistance due to not making enough money.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Midwest City, OK
pros: A ton of pto, amazing benefits, wonderful coworkers
cons: pay is far too low, like 20 years ago this pay would have been great but I can make more elsewhere and moved on.

job_title: Academic Advisor in Midwest City, OK
pros: I love the people from my office. We are like family. Great working environment.
cons: Terrible pay, unfortunately How you network is more important than your ability. :(

job_title: Professor in Midwest City, OK
pros: Rose State College is student-focused from the faculty all the way up to the president. Academic success is a top goal.
cons: Higher ed doesn't seem to be a priority to our state legislators.

job_title: Math Tutor in Midwest City, OK
pros: Flexible Schedule and good experience.
cons: Extremely slow at times but still fun.

job_title: Administrative in Midwest City, OK
pros: Time off, Lots of leave
cons: Favoritism, You cannot grow even if you have the best education in the world if you are not management's favorite employee. They can take the lowest level employee (no degree plus base level salary) and in 2-3 years pay them $65000 plus. You can only make what you deserve if you are their favorite.

job_title: Assistive Technology Specialist in Midwest City, OK
pros:
Easy application process
Good work culture
cons: IT and HR can be a little slow at times, but not too bad.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Midwest City, OK
pros: I have never worked for a more caring, respectful place before rose state. I love it here
cons: The pay isn't great. The communication lacks in general. Even more so within the divisions. None of them seem to know what the other one has going on.

job_title: Software Engineer in New York, NY
pros: Really chill laid back work culture and environment.
cons: I don’t have anything negative to say about this company

job_title: Secretary in Midwest City, OK
pros:
Friendly environment
Great communication
Calm at times
cons: There are no cons to this job

job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Bethany, OK
pros: Good place for learning and training
cons: There’s nothing wrong with this school it is a good place for learning and training

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Midwest City, OK
pros: Flexible schedule, friendly staff and co workers, short hours
cons: low pay no retirement no health insurance hard to get full time

job_title: Math Tutor in Midwest City, OK
pros: Very flexible and lenient on work schedule.
cons: Low pay and very slow at times.

review_title: Probably normal for education, but definitely behind the times
job_title: Administrative Staff in Midwest City, OK
pros:
Steady employment
Decent benefits
Friendly people
A ton of time off
cons:
Incredibly stagnant
Even minor changes or process improvements must go through multiple levels of approval, sometimes even to the regents
Most change never ends up happening
They still do 90% of things on paper, with pens, and filing
When state budgets are cut, forget about pay raises.  I left after the 3rd year with no raise
They grossly undervalue the worth of their workforce.  Pay is around 50-75% of the market rate for any position, and staff positions are 12 months, not 9.
Because of the low pay, they attract mostly slackers with little ambition

job_title: Tutor in Midwest City, OK
pros: Most of the people are nice and the general atmosphere is fairly relaxed.  We are allowed to use our own money to buy into the 403B plan, and finally get to use the Wellness Center.  Neither costs the college any $, but are nice benefits we had to fight for.  Students are great.  Most professors are nice.
cons: Campus politics are a royal pain.  The salaries for part time employees stinks.  When the minimum wage got increased by the federal government last year, they didn't change the differential for degreed, longtime employees.  We were frozen in place, instead of being given the sliding scale above minimum wage we had before Washington got involved. They keep claiming no increase in $ from the legislature has cut back all spending, but don't do anything to save $ in the running of the physical plant of the school.

review_title: Pay could be better, but the benefits are great!
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Midwest City, OK
pros:
Ample time off
Very generous benefits package
Professional work environment
Friendly work environment
Tuition paid
Access to campus amenities such as the Wellness Center
Very supportive management in my area
cons:
Salaries are low compared to most other places, especially for classified staff.
Tends to be gossip, rumors travel fast and far - more so in some departments than others.

review_title: Benefits top notch, but pay very low
job_title: Computer Specialist in Midwest City, OK
pros: Time off is amazing, the best anyone could ask for. Insurance is good for single employee, but when you start to add family it racks up huge. Very laid back atmosphere.
cons: Pay is very low compared to anyone outside of the education system. Management is nothing to be excited about and they are not on the cutting edge of technology.

review_title: I loved working there. Chill atmosphere, fun employees, meet new people every day, nice boss
job_title: Sales Associate in Midwest City, OK
pros: chill, easy, good employees, nice boss, got to meet new people every day, learned new things on the regular, like a little family there, always felt appreciated
cons: not enough hours or $$, went & worked at the University and didn't like it, told my boss, he wasn't to happy about it, and i got let go shortly after

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Faculty and staff are generally polite and helpful.  Each department does a wonderful job in making everyone feel welcomed and a part of the team!
cons: One negative is not having similar rights and privileges as full-time faculty, e.g., paid time off, insurance. Another is pay,  which is not quite competitive with other nearby colleges.

job_title: Library Technical Assistant in Midwest City, OK
pros: Unbeatable benefits. Relaxed atmosphere. Easy to make friends. Looks good as prior experience. Set schedules for full-time staff. Easy to move up the ranks once you're in.
cons: You can live off of the salary, but classified staff don't get paid a lot. Communication between departments tends to be fuzzy. Since it's funded by the state, positions rarely open up.

job_title: Adaptive Technologies Specialist in Midwest City, OK
pros:
Working with students in need.
Opportunities to learn new adaptive technologies and software.
Great office experience.
cons: By working in the office, you are no longer eligible for free counseling at the school (conflict of interest.)

job_title: Coordinator in Midwest City, OK
pros: I retired from Rose State as a full-time employee. The college has great benefits, great leadership, and a teamwork focus.  Great place to work!
cons: State budget cuts will unfortunately be a challenge now.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Midwest City, OK
pros: Great pay, flexible schedule, prestigious, rewarding
cons: Lots of Microsoft management,  pressure
